Subject: Vulnerability Identified in Apache Struts CVE-2024-53677
Description: Internal vulnerability team has identified a recently discovered vulnerability in Apache Struts is affecting our Stealthbits/Enterprise Auditor installation. The CVE mentions there is a newer version of the package that resolves it, but as it was part of the software installation I am not sure how to resolve this. Is Netwrix aware and/or working on a hotfix? C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITActionsSurveyWebServletWEB-INFlibstruts2-core-6.3.0.2.jar Reference Links: https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-53677-critical-vulnerability-in-apache-struts-allows-remote-code-execution https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53677 https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-067
What_We_Know__c: Customer is not using the NEA Survey action module which is the only thing that uses the apache struts binary
Next_Steps__c:
Issue has been remediated in the customer environment as they removed the offending apache struts file (not using/licensed for Survery AM).

A patch has been released in NEA v11.6.0.132+, which now uses Apache Struts 6.7.0. Customer has been notified of this, we are waiting to hear back if they'd like assistance upgrading.
Solution_Comment__c: The vulnerability has been patched. Patch will be available in the next scheduled CU (01/31/2025).
